Learn SEO

Content, Backlinks, Site Structure, Internal Linking and a Multitude of Technical Optimizations.

This content is open source. Help improve it.

The problem with SEO is that there’s so much to learn. It’s a vast domain of knowledge, with many branches that could each take up thier own websites of related information.

SEO is always changing, incorrect and\or outdated information is often republished.

Before you worry about SEO

I haven’t learned to finer points of SEO, because they are irrelevant to me. First, I intend to gain mastery of JAMStack publishing, and lay a proper foundation for my journey.

Until then, I’ve focused on creating curated lists, which I find infinitely more valuable than writing articles devoid of substance, before I know what to write about.

It’s my intention to break SEO down to it’s essential components, and gather links here, while learning. The following sections are arranged with fundamentals at the start, and more comprehensive information towards the end.

Fundamental Building Blocks

  • Content
  • Internal linking and Site Structure
  • Keyword Reserach
  • A Multitude of Technical Optimizations

Many of those optimizations revolve around gradually making every individual piece of code on your site more machine readable, so it communicates essential bits of information that make it stand out from the crowd.

E-A-T

A lot of noise is made about E-A-T, ever since google changed it’s algorithm, in 2018.

Expertise, Authority, and Trustworthiness

Of course, these are important qualities for a web-site to rise through the ranks. But what if you’re just starting out, and you don’t have any of that? No optimization is going to solve that for you. Those qualities must be earned.

Skyscraper Content

One of the fastest ways to gain expertise and authority are to create Skyscraper content! The basic idea of skyscraper content is to create something more expansive than currently available for your subject.

This is one of the most fundamental SEO techniques that works on its own, and in conjunction with any of the other techniques you’ll use.

Evergreen content is a similar meme, along with 10x content. If you create truely valuable content that people need, then the SEO just isn’t as important. People will link to it without asking, and visitors from google will stay on the page longer, causing you to rise up the rankings.

  • graywolfseo.com/seo/evergreen-content/
  • backlinko.com/skyscraper-technique
  • searchenginejournal.com/guide-10x-content-new-successful-content-beyond
  • Guest Blogging
  • “opinion-forming journalism from recognized experts, and data-driven research studies showed a strong correlation between shares and links.”
  • Client case studies: These are shared by the client and can include exciting information about how they achieved their results, which can help others.
  • Infographics: These still get shared heavily online and are a great way to provide an instant view of data on a specific topic. It can be fun and informative, and usually, are republished on other blogs and shared on social media.
  • Other content that highlights influencers: This could include podcasts or video interviews.
  • Industry surveys: Many publishers do annual industry surveys, which have become well-known (and well-cited) each time they are released.
  • Free content or tools: This could include long-form content such as ebooks, or useful tools like quizzes and personalized reports that give users the helpful information they didn’t know before. -What to do when things go wrong
  • 1000 word articles vs 2000 word articles
  • Historical Blog SEO Optimization
